alert.note: Alert for Montrose; San Miguel (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 3:55PM MDT until July 01 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in southwest Colorado, San Miguel. In west central Colorado, Montrose. * WHEN...Until 515 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Naturita Creek and Hamilton Creek drainages. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Naturita and Redvale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
